meanings.definition: A device used to control the speed of a vehicle when descending a steep hill.
meanings.sent1: The haulbacks helped the car slow down safely on the steep slope.
meanings.sent2: Truck drivers rely on haulbacks to manage their speed on downhill roads.
meanings.sent3: The haulbacks decided to take a break and let the car coast down the hill.
meanings.sent4: The haulbacks acted like a gentle hand guiding the vehicle down the mountain.
meanings.sent5: With the haulbacks engaged, the descent felt controlled and secure.

meanings.definition: The act of pulling or dragging something back.
meanings.sent1: She used the haulbacks to bring the heavy box closer to her.
meanings.sent2: The team's haulbacks were essential in retrieving the lost equipment.
meanings.sent3: The haulbacks played tug-of-war with the stubborn object, eventually winning.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the haulbacks that pulled him back from giving up.
meanings.sent5: The haulbacks of teamwork brought the project back on track.

meanings.definition: A type of fishing gear consisting of a line with hooks and bait.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman carefully set up his haulbacks before casting his line.
meanings.sent2: The old sailor's favorite haulbacks never failed to attract a good catch.
meanings.sent3: The haulbacks were so effective that even the fish couldn't resist.
meanings.sent4: The haulbacks danced in the water, luring in the curious fish.
meanings.sent5: The shiny haulbacks shimmered in the sunlight, tempting the fish below.
